name: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid
Reason: 2-hydroxy-3-methoxybenzoic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is benzoic acid, which has a melting point of 120 degrees Celsius (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methoxy group and a hydroxyl group. The methoxy group introduces additional molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The carbonyl group introduces a dipole, estimated at approximately +10 degrees Celsius.
